title: 113_hr421
content: The Act may be cited as the "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013". It includes improvements to COPS grants. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" amends Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice, headed by a Director appointed by the Attorney General with final authority over grants, agreements, and contracts. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice, granting the Attorney General authority over grants, agreements, and contracts awarded by the COPS Office for community policing and crime prevention purposes. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice. It includes provisions to award grants for hiring school resource officers and establishing partnerships between law enforcement agencies and school systems to enhance school safety and combat crime. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice. It includes provisions to assist schools with emergency preparedness, preventative measures for natural disasters, violence, and terrorism, as well as innovative programs to reduce illegal drug activities. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice. It includes provisions for enhancing community policing and crime prevention grants, as well as Troops-to-Cops Programs to hire former military members as law enforcement officers in communities affected by military base closures. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice. It includes provisions for enhancing community policing and crime prevention grants, as well as Troops-to-Cops Programs to hire former military members as law enforcement officers in communities adversely affected by military base closures. The Act also allows for technology grants to assist law enforcement agencies in preventing crime. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" amends various paragraphs by updating definitions, establishing training centers, and reallocating funds within subsection (h). The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" updates subsections (a), (i), and (j) by changing references to different subsections. Section 1702(c) of title I is also amended to include a new paragraph (8) regarding grant applications for officers performing homeland security duties. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" updates funding limits and definitions for law enforcement officers under the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968. Authorization of appropriations is also adjusted for fiscal years 2013 through 2017. The "COPS Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2013" updates funding limits and definitions for law enforcement officers under the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 for fiscal years 2013 through 2017. In subparagraph (B), funding allocation for grants is adjusted with $600,000,000 designated for grants specified in section 1701(c) and $250,000,000 for grants under section 1701(e).
